author: shirogat
title: Children write African stories
description: Les enfants africains des zones marginalisées n'ont pas la possibilité d'utiliser les outils numériques pour raconter leurs propres histoires.

f6_assessments.q0: I do think that, as a social purpose, its great. However, I do not think that this idea addresses the challenge. You have a good use of Cardano blockchain as a medium to achieve what you want, but you are not creating awareness to people who actually are interested in the crypto world but has English as a barrier. That said, I do think that this idea could be more well implemented in some other challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
If I understood correctly, you already has the platform to get everything going, what is missing is the implementation of the blockchain and there is no mention of this cost in the budget attached.

I am finding quite hard to understand some particularities. First, the equipment needed to create this virtual environment will be given to schools or are you selecting schools that already has at least the computers? Since internet cost was added, I'm imagining that the schools do not have the computer (where is this cost?). Second, what are the kids incentive? And the teachers (which are increase the amount of work done)? And school? 

I feel that it has potential but it needs more detail to allow me to understand if it could work or not (I do imagine that it works since you have a partnership with the gov and Microsoft, but I didn't understand how everything works, it was not clear for me).
f6_assessments.q2:
I really think that if you have the platform running would be easy to verify how many stories is being added throughout time. However how this number is going to convert to Cardano is still a mystery to me.

It would be nice to have a metric that evaluate the kids evolution, determining what is the impact of this idea in the children development and education.

Since the working mechanism was not clear to me, it's hard to judge or give ideas of metrics and adding stuffs to audit.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated namely African children dont have sufficient storybooks to read and literacy is low. Also they have no means to write their own stories in their own languages. It is clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief . 
This proposal shows clearly how it adds value to the Cardano system. While it clearly increases literacy and identity strengthening of these kids, its  clear how  Cardano system is benefitted in the sense that the kids are gaining familiarity with Cardano and more importantly grow up with a sense of awareness and trust in Cardano which means later they will use Cardano over other cryptos, and over fiat currency.

Have key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly 
  Key metrics are clear, reasonable and realistic.The key metrics and goals of the proposal may fall within the scope of the challenge.
Proposal can scale to address future challenges by increasing the quantity of stories written and books published.

This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system by increasing the awareness and trust among school kids for Cardano who will grow up to use Cardano system in many other ways. 
I have given this proposal a 4 star rating because it has gone into great detail and shown a realistic and reasonable understanding of the scope of work as well as a very reasonable budget.

If this does not receive funding for whatever reason, one way proposer can improve it is by continuing to create the books, and get some media exposure on various literacy related FB groups and pages, or creative writing related pages. Sometimes , doing that might motivate someone to view the media publication and give him a better idea on the project which enables him to vote for the project. 

You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise.

I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has  provided evidence of the website of the ongoing project.  This contains the team whose relevant skills and experience are needed to complete the project. It would have been better if they put the linkedin profiles of team members along with their experience right here, rather than directing us to a website.
 These links are not sufficient. Linkedin or FB profiles would have added value.
I have visted links. The ASB site is quite comprehensive but doesn;t contain details of core leadership or team members.
 .
There is no way to assess their competence as no personal profile links are given.  The website contains various books already done, but this doesnt give any indication of their competence to integrate with Cardano.  The proposal doesnt give details of team members.
There is no team structure and breakdown and is already successfully implementing the project.
There is no team structure and breakdown and is already successfully implementing the project. The budget is reasonable to achieve the set goals. 
 
The proposer has not provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required, but since this project has already done several live events, there is no reason to suggest that additional funding would be needed for this round.The timetable is realstic to continue the book creation.The proposal  does not provide  a sensible and conductible plan for implementation. It has a very high level broad plan but there is no detailed breakdown in the plan. Resources  necessary to implement the proposal are well described.The proposal does not have technical aspects but covers aspects such as developing the storybooks and training writers. Also covers developing monitoring tools. The proposer has not identified risks in this proposal but plans on developing monitoring tools and reporting, as well as support visits to the schools.  THere would also be training programmes for teachers. This too would reduce risk of non acceptance. But this is not of concern since this is a long running successful literacy building project, and the funds required are to add to existing donor base. You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a clear roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. These include Communicating with schools as to how to support digital uptake, build resources in schools, write and edit 500 books, build monitoring tools, reporting methods, and schedule support visits.
There are clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal namely How many schools are on board, how many new books written, how many new books edited and illustrated, how many schools visited for follow up, how many monitoring tools developed, Train teachers to be sensitive and competent in book creation. 
 Uploading the books to the cloud. 
There is a clear understandable description of the targeted problem as well as a clear understandable solution to solve it.
Possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties have not been identified by the proposer but since this is a successful project , with a history of funding success, It is unlikely to imagine that unforeseen problems will arise.  

 
Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.

f6_assessments.q2: Nothing has been shared about the team behind the proposal, even if the Virtual Learning Solutions has been presented, but it would still important to learn more about the people overseeing the idea.

f6_assessments.q2: The proposer/s have written a good proposal, it will be easy to audit because there is a timeline to show when each thing will be done as well as a concise well written plan and a clear set of goals.

f6_assessments.q0: While this might be a valuable idea it doesn't meet the goal of motivating non english speakers to learn and grow the cardano ecosystem in the next 3 to 6 months.

f6_assessments.q2: This idea is very complicated and will take a lot of time, effort and money. The information provided isn't enough to decide wether this idea will work as well as intended.

f6_assessments.q1: They have experience in education so they can do as their plan. The plan is also clear as they will do step by step. However in my opinion the results will be dependent on who are the ones that really participate in these work, we don't have many information about that.
f6_assessments.q2: We can audit the process as they can easily provide the evidence of their activities (videos, records etc). The proposal also includes clear and well-defined KPIs and expected output, which will help the progress and success of the project become more auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has almost nothing to do with Cardano and is going in the wrong direction that the challenge is headed. The proposal talks about the opportunity of African children to use digital tools to tell their own stories, while the challenge is looking for proposals that can make Cardano more widely accessible around the world in multiple languages.
f6_assessments.q1: The relevant experience of the proponent is relevant to the proposal. This will help African children get digitalized quickly. However, it took a large group of people to complete this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Proposals can be easily followed through clearly stated activities with recorded videos, images, etc. However, the budget for each activity has not been specified for the community to consider the success of the proposal.
